intro: Rubus eucalyptus var. eucalyptus, commonly known as the common blackberry, is a shrub native to the Americas. It produces dark purple to black berries that are rich in antioxidants and have a tart flavor. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces white to pink flowers in the spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for both its fruit and ornamental value. The berries are typically consumed fresh or used in jams and desserts.
